description.narrative: This project aims to improve the capacity for analysis and decision making through strengthening the coordination, collection, processing, analysis and dissemination of information relevant to humanitarian and development sectors.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Availability of information management support to agencies, government departments and donors to improve emergency preparedness, promote coordination and inform humanitarian response.

comment.narrative: 30,000+ individual users of the MIMU website (monthly average) 1 analytical piece supporting humanitarian and development programming (MMR language Vulnerability Report) 700+ agencies using MIMU information services (Contact List) 150+ Trainees in MIMU technical training activities (baseline as no requests at the time of writing the proposal) 270 maps developed to support emergency, humanitarian and development activities 7 inter-agency coordination meetings led by MIMU (Information management Network, GIS working group) MIMU Client Survey to assess user satisfaction and needs. Finalisation of National Coding System with GAD Finalisation of the MIMU-developed EMIS School Mapping Platform with MoE

Average 59,196 individual users of the MIMU website (monthly average) MMR version of the countrywide analysis finalized and disseminated: Vulnerability in Myanmar: A secondary data review of needs, coverage and gaps 947 agencies using MIMU services (Contact List) 407 trainees (58% female) in MIMU technical training activities 580 maps developed to support emergency and other interventions 9 inter-agency coordination meetings led by MIMU (IM Network x 6, GIS Seminar x 1 2-day event for 67 persons, GIS WG x 2) National Coding System soft launch held by GAD (August) MIMU Client Survey conducted to assess user satisfaction and needs (September). EMIS with MIMU-developed School Mapping Platform launched by MoE (December)

30,000+ individual users of the MIMU website (monthly average) 10 analytical piece supporting humanitarian and development programming 700+ agencies using MIMU information services (Contact List) 150+ Trainees in MIMU technical training activities (baseline as no requests at the time of writing the proposal) 270 maps developed to support emergency, humanitarian and development activities 7 inter-agency coordination meetings led by MIMU (Information management Network, GIS working group) MIMU External Evaluation Launch of National Coding System with GAD

Average >62,000 individual users of the MIMU website (monthly average) _EXCEEDED TARGET Analytical briefs – activities delayed due to COVID situation (recruitment delays). 2 pieces produced in this period (one analytical brief prepared, one landmine infographic launched in this period. Data Analyst activity will need to be stepped up significantly to meet the targets. _DID NOT MEET TARGET 1057 agencies using MIMU services (Contact List) _EXCEEDED TARGET 227 trainees (51% female) in MIMU technical training activities _EXCEEDED TARGET 1099 maps developed to support emergency and other interventions _EXCEEDED TARGET 7 inter-agency coordination meetings led by MIMU (IM Network x 5, Kobo orientation and Experience sharing session on Approaches to Virtual training) _ MET TARGET MIMU External Evaluation conducted as planned and recommendations discussed with the MIMU Advisory Board._ MET TARGET National Coding System launch delayed due to COVID situation and elections, however GAD requested support for the launch in late December so this will go ahead in Q1-2 2021. _DELAYS IN REACHING TARGET BEYOND MIMU CONTROL Provision of platform for information exchange on COVID and engagement in the COVID Information Support Unit (UNOPS/MIMU) - ADDITIONAL RESULT

30,000+ individual users of the MIMU website (monthly average) 10 analytical briefs/infographics supporting humanitarian and development programming 700+ agencies using MIMU information services (Contact List) 150+ Trainees in MIMU technical training activities (baseline as no requests at the time of writing the proposal) 270 maps developed to support emergency, humanitarian and development activities 7 inter-agency coordination meetings led by MIMU (Information management Network, GIS working group) Launch of National Coding System with GAD, OMM Internal streamlining project finalized and in place to facilitate MIMU team activities Photo Archive launched and in use to reflect agencies humanitarian and development activities countrywide. Maintain high levels of use of MIMU COVID platform and work on CISU.

av 57,000 monthly individual users of the MIMU website (monthly average) _EXCEEDED TARGET 10 analytical briefs/infographics supporting humanitarian and development programming_TARGET MET_11 infographic/analytical brief products launched related to data analysis 1061 agencies using MIMU information services (Contact List) _EXCEEDED TARGET however the Contact List has been removed from the public domain following the February 2021 events 333 Trainees in MIMU technical training activities (baseline as no requests at the time of writing the proposal) _EXCEEDED TARGET 257 maps developed to support emergency, humanitarian and development activities_ SLIGHTLY BELOW TARGET due to slow down in agency mapping for several months following the February 2021 events 14 inter-agency coordination meetings led by MIMU (Information management Network, GIS working group) _EXCEEDED TARGET Launch of National Coding System with GAD, OMM – TARGET NOT MET due to suspension of UN work with the authorities following February events Internal streamlining project finalized and in place to facilitate MIMU team activities _TARGET MET Photo Archive launched and in use to reflect agencies humanitarian and development activities countrywide _TARGET MET Maintain high levels of use of MIMU COVID platform and work on CISU / COVID Information Support Unit _TARGET MET for COVID platform. CISU work has slowed down following the February 2021 events.
